context: 'Ajame' is the first-person plural present indicative form of the Estonian verb 'ajama'. It means 'we drive', 'we hurry', or 'we push' depending on context. The verb has many meanings including driving vehicles, hurrying someone along, pushing physically, causing certain states or emotions, and following a path or pattern. In its first-person plural present form, it typically refers to the subject (we) performing one of these actions.
